DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to compare the efficacy and safety of Ibuprofen 5% Topical Gel versus placebo administered two or three times daily for the treatment of pain associated with delayed onset muscle soreness following intense eccentric exercise of the elbow flexor muscles.
DOC.brief_title: Topical Ibuprofen for Delayed Onset Mulscle Soreness
DOC.criteria: Males or females, 18 to 65 years of age, who have not engaged in upper extremity fitness activities for a minimum of 3 months prior to entry in the study; subjects must be willing to refrain from use of pharmacologic or non pharmacologic treatments (ie, heat, ice, massage) and other forms of soreness relief during the study Use of corticosteroids or short or longacting nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs
